p: The intensity of light also played major role in the production of L. minor. In the experiment 2, as light intensity reduced, particularly in the second and third phases (718–2,138 lux), production reduced drastically; an increasing trend was recorded as light intensity increased (3,463–3,728 lux) in experiment 2. In the present study, maximum L. minor production was recorded at 7,353–10,878 lux light intensity. Mkandawire and Dudel ( 2007) suggested 4,200–6,700 lux light intensity at 14–16 h photoperiod for the optimum production of L. gibba and L. minor.
